intro: Odontonychia erecta, commonly known as the upright toothed fern, is a species of fern characterized by its distinctive, upright fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions. The plant features serrated, tooth-like margins on its leaves, which give it its common name. Its rhizomes are thick and creeping, allowing it to spread and form dense colonies. Odontonychia erecta thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
